body.default: Just commenting for the sake of commenting

externalDocs.description: find out more about github-all's web-apis

info.description: this zero-dependency package will provide a swagger-client for github-all's web-apis, with a working web-demo
info.title: swgg-github-all

github-gists.public.description: Indicates whether the gist is public. Default: false
github-gists.public.name: public

github-gists.since.description: A timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.
github-gists.since.name: since

github-repositories.branch.description: The branch name. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually master).
github-repositories.branch.name: branch

github-repositories.content.description: The new file content, Base64 encoded.
github-repositories.content.name: content

github-repositories.ref.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually master).
github-repositories.ref.name: ref

github-repositories.sha.description: The blob SHA of the file being replaced.
github-repositories.sha.name: sha

get.description:
Events - List public events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events

Gists - List a user's gists. List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will return all public gists.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-a-users-gists

Gists - List all public gists. List all public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-all-public-gists

Gists - List starred gists. List the authenticated user's starred gists.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-starred-gists

Gists - Get a single gist.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#get-a-single-gist

Comments - List comments on a gist.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/comments/#list-comments-on-a-gist

Comments - Get a single comment.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/comments/#get-a-single-comment

Gists - List gist commits.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-gist-commits

Gists - List gist forks.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-gist-forks

Gists - Check if a gist is starred.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#check-if-a-gist-is-starred

put.description:
Gists - Star a gist. Note that you'll need to set Content-Length to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "HTTP verbs" (https://developer.github.com/v3/#http-verbs).

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#star-a-gist

get.description:
Gists - Get a specific revision of a gist.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#get-a-specific-revision-of-a-gist

Events - List public events for a network of repositories.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-for-a-network-of-repositories

Events - List public events for an organization.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-for-an-organization

delete.description:
Contents - Delete a file. This method deletes a file in a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#delete-a-file

get.description:
Contents - Get contents. This method returns the contents of a file or directory in a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-contents

put.description:
Contents - Create a file. This method creates a new file in a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#create-a-file

Contents - Update a file. This method updates a file in a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#update-a-file

get.description:
Events - List repository events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-repository-events

Events - List issue events for a repository. Repository issue events have a different format than other events, as documented in the Issue Events API.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-issue-events-for-a-repository

Contents - Get the README. This method returns the preferred README for a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-the-readme

Contents - Get archive link. This method will return a 302 to a URL to download a tarball or zipball archive for a repository.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-archive-link

parameters.description: Can be either tarball or zipball. Default: tarball.
parameters.name: archive_format

parameters.description: A valid Git reference. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually master).
parameters.name: ref

get.description:
Events - List events performed by a user. If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-performed-by-a-user

Events - List events for an organization. This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-for-an-organization

Events - List public events performed by a user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-performed-by-a-user

Gists - List a user's gists. List public gists for the specified user.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-a-users-gists

Events - List events that a user has received. These are events that you've received by watching repos and following users. If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-events-that-a-user-has-received

Events - List public events that a user has received.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/#list-public-events-that-a-user-has-received

tags.description:
Serving up the 'social' in Social Coding, the Activity APIs provide access to notifications, subscriptions, and timelines.

https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/
tags.name: github-activity

tags.description:
find out more about github-gists's.

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/
tags.name: github-gists

find out more about github-repositories's web-apis.

https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/
tags.name: github-repositories
